title: About
text:
Profile picture
Hello! I am Francesco Dâ€™Amico, a PhD student in Physics at Sapienza University of Rome, where I work under the supervision of Matteo Negri and Chiara Cammarota.
My research lies at the intersection of statistical mechanics, machine learning, and complex systems, with a focus on how ideas from physics can illuminate modern AI and vice versa.

title: About
text:
Research Interests

The role of data structure in training machine learning models

Associative memories and Transformer-inspired architectures

Algorithms for approximate likelihoods in energy-based models

Optimization and inference in hard computational tasks
